title: REST Start Event
description: Today in nearby every ivy project there is a big need for REST services. Either to provide data for Mobile Applications or to implement loosly coupled Micro Services. Ivy developers have currently no convenient way to provide API from the ivy core or business specific API as REST service. So we will fill this gap in the Code Camp 2015!

featureset.title: REST Start Event
featureset.description:
1. Make any functional sub process REST callable. Use standard parameter mapping as input and return JSON as response.
  2. Let the user inscribe the REST configuration (at least the path) in an additional tab of the CallSub start event.
  3. Create a re-usable tested ivy project to demonstrate the new REST capabilities

featureset.title: REST Bean
featureset.description: 1. Scan beans in ivy projects for JAX-RS REST annotations and let em run within an ivy process context.

featureset.title: Out of scope
featureset.description: 1. There is already a simple REST call step prototype. So we will not go any further in this area yet.
